articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Minnesota kids in child care homes to be fingerprinted
articles.description: ST. PAUL, Minn. (AP) — Some Minnesota lawmakers and daycare providers say a new law collecting fingerprints from older children in child care homes goes too far. The Pioneer Press reports that the law requires children ages 13 through 17 to be fingerprinted a…

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Minnesota to see hungry ticks emerge in warm weather
articles.description: ST. PAUL, Minn. (AP) — An expert says the delayed spring and a week of temperatures reaching 65 degrees Fahrenheit means ticks will likely come out soon in large numbers in Minnesota. Ticks can transmit diseases, such as Lyme disease, human anaplasmosis and b…

articles.title: Minnesota reaching deadline to get insurance rate approval
articles.description: ST. PAUL, Minn. (AP) — Minnesota is running out of time to receive the federal government’s approval of its plan to lower health insurance premiums next year. The $542 million reinsurance proposal would keep premiums purchased through the state exchange about…

articles.author: Jim Brunner and Susan Kelleher
articles.title: Cary Moon: Urbanist, waterfront activist touts vision for city, faces questions about résumé, accomplishments
articles.description: Seattle mayoral candidate Cary Moon has won praise as an articulate urbanist and activist who crusaded against Seattle’s waterfront tunnel. But a look at her professional and civic life shows sparse management experience.

articles.author: Corey Kilgannon
articles.title: Thrifty Brooklyn secretary leaves $8 million for needy students
articles.description: Even her closest friends and relatives had no idea that Sylvia Bloom had amassed a fortune over the decades. In her will, the frugal legal secretary gave most of it for college scholarships to needy students.
